page.title: 07Farming Wardens Lodge
page.content: Mr. Stock of Wardens Lodge farms about 200 acres near Willingale. He has been farming for about 60 years and sees the loss of animals on the farm as the biggest change in the last ten years. Many of the unused farm buildings around the farmhouse are evidence of the change from dairy to mixed farming. He now breeds sheep (Dorset Downs) which he sells for meat. He grows wheat, barley, rape and potatoes. The farmhouse was built around l850 and is a typical building of this time having a "marbled" pillared porch over the front door. He has six tractors, one combine, one corn drill. 3 cultivators, 1 plough and a hay baler. The Stocks do not grow vegetables in their garden, only flowers.
